description: Commissioned officer designated to lead a task, mission, or operation.
Senior NCO responsible for oversight and execution within a section or task.
Second-in-command; synchronizes staff and daily operations.
Officer with command authority over a unit.
Enlisted leader responsible for training, discipline, and welfare of Soldiers.
Recognized technical or functional expert in a given area.
Directives that define the circumstances and limits for the use of force.
Geographic area assigned to a commander for military operations.
Unit command post that controls current operations.
Secured forward location supporting tactical operations.
Integrated process of collecting and analyzing information to support decisions.
Systematic process to analyze enemy, terrain, and weather.
Abbreviated order that modifies a published OPORD.
Directive issued by a commander for coordinated execution of an operation.
Preliminary notice of an upcoming operation or order.
Levels of protective gear against chemical, biological, radiological, and nuclear threats.
Observer responsible for calling for and adjusting indirect fire.
Formal request for specific information or intelligence.
Directive to complete a task without delay.
Program designed to strengthen fitness and readiness through prevention, testing, and rehabilitation.
Military unit typically consisting of 300–1,000 Soldiers.
Military unit typically consisting of several battalions, 3,000–5,000 Soldiers.
Military unit typically consisting of 10,000–15,000 Soldiers.
Military formation that consists of two or more divisions.
U.S. Army training center at Fort Johnson (formerly Fort Polk).
U.S. Army training center at Fort Irwin, California.
Structured review of performance conducted after a training event or operation.
Report providing a summary of a unit’s current situation.
Information identified as being critical to facilitating timely decision making.
Intelligence requirement identified by the commander as a priority for decision making.
A potential plan or option for accomplishing a mission or task.
Shared display of relevant information across a command.
Deliberate planning process used by Army units to make decisions.
Set of laws that govern all U.S. military personnel.
Structured exercise program to maintain Soldier fitness.
Specific job classification in the U.S. Army.
Statement describing how a commander intends to accomplish a mission.
Reserve unit to which a Soldier is assigned.
Soldiers serving full-time in support of the National Guard or Reserve.
Plan created to guide a Soldier’s professional growth and career goals.
Formal education programs designed to develop military leaders.
Unified command with broad continuing missions under a single commander.
Established procedures for performing a task or mission.
Formal document outlining agreed terms between organizations or parties.
Self-contained field ration for individual service members.
Military cafeteria where meals are prepared and served.
Retail store on a military installation.
Short-term military assignment away from a Soldier’s permanent duty station.
Relocation of a Soldier to a new duty station.
